job_description: Regulatory Data Analyst - job post Marsh Consulting Services Chicago, IL 60642 • Hybrid remote $30 - $36 an hour -  Contract Responded to 75% or more applications in the past 30 days, typically within 12 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $30 - $36 an hour Job Type Contract long term hybrid contract, must be local to office, probably just 1 day per week in office As a member of Scientific & Regulatory Affairs (SRA), the incumbent is responsible for screening, tracking and maintaining regulatory information on ingredients at our client. Accurate and complete ingredient information is the foundation for regulatory compliance of the finished product and labeling. In addition to ensuring data accuracy and completeness, the incumbent will leverage ingredient and regulatory knowledge to critically evaluate data quality to ingredient composition, nutrition and other key regulatory information is consistent. Success in this role will require stakeholder management and collaboration at a global and regional level, both within the SRA function and cross-functionally. The incumbent will work closely with other global SRA associates to evaluate performance against the metrics and drive continuous improvement. Key Responsibilities Screen and approve new ingredient per the aligned service level agreement to ensure data accuracy and completeness Obtain updated ingredient information per aligned business priority and cadence Interface with regional SRA, R&D and Specification teams to continuously improve specification and recipe systems Track key ingredient screening metrics to drive continuous improvement Support regulatory change management by performing key ingredient searches in the database to evaluate impact of regulatory change Attend necessary project and meetings in order to communicate progress and opportunity for improvement Context and Scope The incumbent applies technical, organizational, and project managerial skills broadly to screen and approve ingredients and collaborates with cross-functional stakeholders in regional SRA, R&D and Specification teams. The incumbent works with a high level of independence, based on regulatory knowledge and experience, to make decisions and deploy best practices that assure global compliance of ingredients and mitigate regulatory risks. Education Minimum: A Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition, Food Science, Food Safety, or Food Process Engineering is required. Knowledge/Experience 2-3 years' experience in regulatory affairs at a food, beverage, or consumer products company is required International regulatory experience is a preferred High degree of ownership with strong sense of urgency and an action-biased, positive attitude Good critical thinking, able to operate independently Demonstrated team collaboration competencies, with strong organization and complex problem solving skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, self-directed, forward thinking, and ability to make recommendations with limited information/data Ability to quickly adapt, learn on the fly and understand complex processes and concepts Ability to challenge status quo of current ways of working to build robust new ideas Job Type: Contract Pay: $30.00 - $36.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: Regulatory food compliance: 3 years (Preferred) Data analysis skills: 3 years (Preferred) Work Location: Hybrid remote in Chicago, IL 60642 If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Contract Business Analyst - job post Eversheds Sutherland 39 reviews Chicago, IL 60611 $40 - $80 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $40 - $80 an hour Job Type Contract We have an exciting opportunity for a Contract Business Analyst at Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP. We are searching for someone who wants to be a valued contributor and member of a talented and dynamic team of lawyers, paralegals and staff. The Contract Business Analyst is responsible for the requirements from elicitation to implementation ensuring the end solution meets the business needs. The Contract Business Analyst works closely with internal customers and IT teams to define, manage and document requirements for several concurrent initiatives. Responsibilities and Duties: Gathers, understands, analyzes, and documents the need of project stakeholders, formalizing the needs into a set of actionable business requirements. Analyzes, evaluates, and documents the current business processes and identifies future state, including business process modeling. Leads and completes vendor and software selection assessment, as needed. Schedules, plans, and leads requirement gathering and review meetings. Documents and communicates key decisions and actions items. Partners on development and implementation of standard business analysis tools and methodologies with BA team and PMO Manager. Monitors cross-functional deliverables ensuring timely completion of requirement analysis and solution design. Supports change management. Researches and reviews up-to-date business processes and new IT advancements to make systems more modern. Engages with stakeholders at all levels. Performs user acceptance testing. Delivers engaging, informative, well-organized presentations to project sponsors and team members. Clearly communicates project issues and proposed mitigations to stakeholders and management. Collaborates with project managers and cross-functional teams throughout the project implementation cycle, as needed. Manages competing resources and priorities. Coordinates the day-to-day operational aspects of an initiative with PMO Manager. Applies and understands the full analysis process: Defining scope Identifying project benefits Developing business cases Requirements elicitation and management Process optimisation Business change management Requirements tractability to business benefits Input into testing Facilitating user acceptance testing Benefits realization Other duties as assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: A Bachelor’s degree is required in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field, from an accredited college or university or an equivalent combination of an Associate degree with related job experience. Required Certifications: Industry recognized Business Analyst Certification (CAP or PBA or IIBA etc.) or Project Management Certification (PMP, SCM etc.) Five-seven years of experience working in a Technology Department is required, with a preference given for work experience in a multi-office legal environment. A minimum of five years of experience in leading projects as a business analyst. Familiar with software development methodologies such as Waterfall and Agile Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills are required. Detail-oriented and organized. Ability to multi-task and prioritize workloads. Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language. Strong problem solving and decision-making skills. Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS Office Suite with proficiency in Outlook are required. Salary is commensurate with years of experience and geographic location. The hourly rate for this position will be $40-80/hr. Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within our Firm and in the larger legal profession. We believe that diverse skills, knowledge and viewpoints make us a stronger firm. Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP maintains a policy of affording all employees and applicants equal employment opportunities without regard to actual or perceived race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or expression or transgender status), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital or familial status, domestic violence victim status, ancestry, amnesty, citizenship status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
